document_data.name: Bankenfuere
document_data.Description: The sword had a wavy 4-ft-long (1.2 m) blade with an 8-in-long (0.2 m) [[wikipedia:ricasso|ricasso]] before the hilt and cross guard. Berkthgar carried his weapon in a shoulder sheath on his back.
document_data.History:
Around [[1358 DR]], Berkthgar fought the famed [[Companions of the Hall|Companion of the Hall]] Catti-brie with Bankenfuere in [[Settlestone]] to settle a disagreement Berkthgar had with [[Bruenor Battlehammer]] over [[Wulfgar]]'s [[warhammer]], ''[[Aegis-fang]]''.

After the battle, Berkthgar declared he would make a new legend of his sword, Bankenfuere the Northern Fury. Catti-brie called the sword "Cow-killer".
